title: Pt 1 - 3 tips to make your homesteading self-sufficient lifestyle successful while staying debt free

tasks.task: Observing the property for a year to understand its natural resources and ecosystems.
subtasks: Walk through the property weekly or daily.
Observe changes in the property throughout different seasons.
Document locations of natural resources (e.g., nut trees, blueberry bushes) by sketching or using GPS.
Adjust plans considering natural resources for future agriculture and livestock.

tasks.task: Developing a budget and plan for homesteading.
subtasks: Create a spreadsheet for yearly goals and estimated costs.
Account for the initial setup costs of key elements (e.g., chicken coop, rabbit hutch, goat barn).
Prioritize investments based on financial viability and resource efficiency (e.g., rabbits over chickens).
Break down homesteading expenses into manageable annual budgets considering income and current debt.

tasks.task: Managing finances to support homesteading goals without increasing debt.
subtasks: Maintain a source of income while beginning homesteading activities.
Allocate budgets for homesteading projects after accounting for living expenses.
Track expenses using spreadsheets or financial management tools.

tasks.task: Building and maintaining infrastructure for homesteading.
subtasks: Estimate time and costs for constructing homestead structures (e.g., chicken coop, rabbit hutch).
Allocate time and budget for potential delays or unexpected setbacks in construction.
Protect investments (e.g., manuals, fencing) to prevent damage from animals or other factors.
Plan and implement seasonal tasks for continuous homesteading improvement (e.g., planting, animal care).

tasks.task: Emphasizing the importance of a plan and observation in successful homesteading.
subtasks: Recognize the need for a preparatory year before intensive homesteading.
Understand that upfront planning reduces costly mistakes and maximizes resource utilization.
Acknowledge the compounded effects of careful planning in achieving both homesteading and debt freedom.
Share personal experiences to provide relatable real-world examples for viewers.
